sen.j: 中古（ちゅうこ）とは、時代区分に用いられる表現の1つで、上古・中古・近古の三分法を用いた際の2番目に相当する。
sen.e: Chuko (middle ages) is a word to describe a time period, and it is the second one of the three (trichotomy) which are joko (ancient times), chuko (middle ages), and kinko (early modern age).

sen.j: 日本文学史においては「中古六歌仙」・「中古三十六歌仙」などの語が存在する。
sen.e: In Japanese literary history, the word chuko was used in 'chuko rokkasen (six Japanese poets presented in the prelude of Kokinshu, A Collection of Ancient and Modern Poetry in the early Heian period)' and 'chuko sanjurokkasen (36 Japanese poets of Nochi no Rokurokusen selected by FUJIWARA no Norikane).'

sen.j: そのため、国文学界においては平安時代（794年-1192年）を指して用いられる。
sen.e: Therefore, chuko is regarded as a word meaning the Heian period (794-1192) in Japanese literature.
Chuko is therefore regarded as a word used to refer to the Heian period (794 - 1192) in Japanese literature.

sen.j: その一方で国文学界が鎌倉時代以後を本来は同じ意味である「中世」という語で表現する事に対して疑問も出されている。
sen.e: At the same time, the time period after the Kamakura period is expressed as the 'Middle Ages,' the word having the same meaning as chuko, in Japanese literature, and appropriateness of this practice has been questioned.

On the other hand, Japanese literature also uses the term "chusei" to refer to the time period after the Kamakura period which has the same meaning as chuko, and the appropriateness of this practice has been questioned.

sen.j: このため、近年では「中古」という語を用いない傾向にある。
sen.e: For this reason, the word 'chuko' is not used much any more.
